title: cmd/godoc: document package-level examples
body:
godoc presents package documentation with the Overview first, then the Index, then
Examples.  Often the Overview documentation includes examples of how to use the package,
but these are not compiled and tested as example functions; they are just text.  I'd
like to be able to include package-level examples that are compiled and tested.

Options:
- Just as we extract ExampleF() as an example for function F in the package, we could
extract Example() as a package-level example (and Example_note() for a secondary
example).  The primary example could be opened by default, immediately following the
overview.
- Or we could adopt a model similar to the present tool: allow the Overview (and
possibly other godoc comments) to embed code from other files in the package, extracted
with subcommands like the one present uses:
  .code example_test.go /START/,/END/
